posts.title: Nephew Killed in a hit and run - update
posts.content:
Previous post: https://patriots.win/p/17txVpQJCy/update-on-nephew-that-was-killed/c

My sister has received a copy of the accident report from the hit and run that killed my nephew in July last year. The owner of the truck was indeed of hispanic origin based on the name. The man denies that he was driving the truck. A witness picked him and 2 others out of a line up and the investigator has received the cell phone records which indicate his location at the time of the accident.

They will be presenting this evidence to the DA but it's circumstantial and we have no idea if the guy will be prosecuted.

I'll leave it up to your imaginations as to what will happen should they choose not to prosecute...

My sister is in a serious depression right now and I have no idea how to help her. I would appreciate prayers for comfort for her and her family as they navigate the continuing grief that is now compounded.

Thanks frens

posts.title: Faith in Jesus Christ as the door to heaven brings the Christian into the spiritual blessings of Heaven.
posts.content:
1 Corinthians 12:8 For to one is given by the Spirit the word of wisdom; to another the word of knowledge by the same Spirit

The infant church is learning how the Spirit manifests in each individual soul.

For to one ᾧ (ō) 3739: usually rel. who, which, that, also demonstrative this, that a prim. pronoun is given δίδοται (didotai) 1325: to give (in various senses lit. or fig.) redupl. from the root do- the word λόγος (logos) 3056: a word (as embodying an idea), a statement, a speech from legó of wisdom σοφίας (sophias) 4678: skill, wisdom from sophos through διὰ (dia) 1223: through, on account of, because of a prim. preposition the Spirit, πνεύματος (pneumatos) 4151: wind, spirit from pneó and to another ἄλλῳ (allō) 243: other, another a prim. word the word λόγος (logos) 3056: a word (as embodying an idea), a statement, a speech from legó of knowledge γνώσεως (gnōseōs) 1108: a knowing, knowledge from ginóskó according κατὰ (kata) 2596: down, against, according to preposition of uncertain origin to the same αὐτὸ (auto) 846: (1) self (emphatic) (2) he, she, it (used for the third pers. pron.) (3) the same an intensive pronoun, a prim. word Spirit; πνεῦμα (pneuma) 4151: wind, spirit from pneó

Jesus Christ manifests in each soul with word of wisdom, and word of knowledge. The seals opened, and the trumpets sounding is the manifestation of the Spirit in each Christian soul. The Revelation of Jesus Christ, is the Holy Spirit revealing and manifesting spiritual reality to the individual Christian.

1 Corinthians 12:9 To another faith by the same Spirit; to another the gifts of healing by the same Spirit;

Faith is a manifestation of the Spirit to profit the individual Christian soul. Faith comes through exploring the Spirit of Christ, in a spiritual relationship with Jesus Christ.

Revelation 4:1 After this I looked, and, behold, a door was opened in heaven: and the first voice which I heard was as it were of a trumpet talking with me; which said, Come up hither, and I will shew thee things which must be hereafter. 2 And immediately I was in the spirit: and, behold, a throne was set in heaven, and one sat on the throne.

Faith in Jesus Christ as the door to heaven brings the Christian into the spiritual blessings of Heaven.

Ephesians 1:3 Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ:
